availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Coleman Daniel (Louisville, Jefferson County, Kentucky, gentleman)

body.p: Louisville, Jefferson County, Kentucky, gentleman. Virginia native. Married to Elizabeth Kaye Daniel in Jefferson County, Kentucky, on April 17, 1817. Plasterer in Louisville in 1850. Owned two enslaved individuals in Louisville in 1850. Gentleman in Louisville in 1860. Owned two enslaved individuals in Louisville in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, District 2, p. 185b.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, District 2, p. 790.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, Ward 3, p. 689.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, Ward 3, p. 263A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Jefferson County Marriages, Film #000482706, p. 92.
Find A Grave, "Coleman Daniel (1791-1863)," Memorial #55431182, accessed December 7, 2020, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/55431182.
